result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua L Wentz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua L Wentz

defendant.name: Wentz, Joshua L

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
No Contact Provision has been canceled. 
44

2:30 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present with Attorney Perry Lieuallen.

ADA recites agreement - moves to amend count 1 to 4th degree sexual assault in violation of  940.225(3m).  Attorney Lieuallen concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - waived.  Court goes over the elements of the offense.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court instructs regarding deportation.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to the amended charge.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently, and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty of the amended charge and orders a judgment of conviction be entered today.  ADA confirms compliance with any victim/witness rights.  Sentencing argument by ADA.  Sentencing argument by Attorney Lieuallen.  No statement by the defendant.

Court orders SWD and places the defendant on probation for 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Sentenced to 5 days county jail with huber - Court remands the defendant to the custody of the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
NO contact with the victim.  Court innstructs regarding forms of no contact.
Perform 40 hours of community service.
Abide with all other rules/recommendations as imposed by the supervising agent.
Pay court costs.

Court adjourned at 2:38 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 20, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Status hearing on May 20, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

2:02 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present with Attorney Perry Lieuallen.

Statement by Attonrey Lieuallen - requests a further Status Hearing be scheduled.  Court directs another Status Hearing to be held in approximately thirty days.

Court adjourned at 2:02 p.m.
Status hearing on April 1, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

No Contact with AW (d/o/b-10/21/1997).  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

No Contact with AW (d/o/b-10/21/1997).  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:53 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Perry Lieuallen.  Kyle Sargent for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Lieuallen confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $5000.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Contact with AW (d/o/b-10/21/1997).  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.  

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.  State files the information with the court.  Attorney Lieuallen and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Lieuallen enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.

Court will set for Status Hearing - Atty to schedule.

Court adjourned at 9:56 a.m.
